1.text: And Jehovah will be seen to him at the oaks of Mamra: and he will sit at the entrance of his tent at the heat of the day.

2.text: And he shall lift up his eyes and shall see, and behold, three men stood by him: and he will see and will run to meet them from the door of the tent, and will bow himself to the earth.

3.text: And he will say, Lord, if now I found grace in thine eyes, now thou wilt not pass away from thy servant.

4.text: Now he shall take a little water, and will wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.

5.text: And I will take a bit of food, and strengthen your heart, afterwards ye shall pass away; for, for this ye passed over to your servant And they will say, Thou shalt do according to what thou saidst.

6.text: And Abraham will hasten to the tent to Sarah, and will say, Hasten thou measures of the finest flour; knead and make cakes.

7.text: And Abraham running to the oxen, will take the son of a cow, tender and good, and will give to the youth, and he will hasten to do it.

8.text: And he will take curdled milk, and new milk, and the son of the cow which he did, and he will give before their face; and he stood by them under the tree, and they shall eat.

9.text: And they will say to him, Where is Sarah thy wife? and he will say, Behold, in the tent.

10.text: And he will say, Returning, I will return to thee according to the time of life; and behold, a son to Sarah thy wife. And Sarah heard at the door of the tent, and she behind him.

11.text: And Abraham and Sarah were old, being gone in days; the way according to women ceased to be to Sarah.

12.text: And Sarah will laugh within her, saying, After it has not been to me till now, and my lord, being old.

13.text: And Jehovah will say to Abraham, For what did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall truly even I bring forth, and I have become old?

14.text: Shall the word of Jehovah be difficult, at the appointed time? I will return to thee, according to the time of life, and a son to Sarah.

15.text: And Sarah will deny, saying, I did not laugh; for she was afraid. And he will say, Nay, for thou didst laugh.

16.text: And the men will rise up from thence, and will look forth upon the face of Sodom: and Abraham went forth with them to accompany them.

17.text: And Jehovah said, Shall I hide from Abraham what I do?

18.text: And Abraham being, shall be for a great and numerous nation, and all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves in him.

19.text: For I know him, for that he will command his sons and his house after him; and they watched the way of Jehovah to do justice and judgment, for Jehovah to bring upon Abraham what he spake to him.

20.text: And Jehovah will say, The cry of Sodom and Gomorrah became great, and because their sin was exceedingly heavy,

21.text: I will go now and see whether they did wholly according to its cry coming to me; and if not, I shall know.

22.text: And the men will turn back from thence, and will go forth to Sodom: and Abraham stood yet before the face of Jehovah.

23.text: And Abraham will draw near, and will say, Wilt thou also destroy the just with the wicked.

24.text: Perhaps there is fifty just in the midst of the city: wilt thou also destroy and not forgive the place for the sake of the fifty just which are within it?

25.text: Far be it with respect to thee doing as this word to kill the just with the wicked; and for the just to be as the wicked, far be it with respect to thee: shall not the judge of all the earth do judgment?

26.text: And Jehovah will say, If I shall find in Sodom fifty just, in the midst of the city, I forgive all the place for their sakes.

27.text: And Abraham will answer and say, Behold now, I have undertaken to speak to my Lord, and I dust and ashes.

28.text: If the fifty just shall lack five: wilt thou destroy for sake of five all the city? And he will say, I will not destroy, if I shall find there forty and five.

29.text: And he added yet to speak to him, and he will say, If forty shall be found there? And he will say, I will not do for sake of forty.

30.text: And he will say, Now will it not kindle to the Lord, and I will speak: If thirty shall be found there? And he will say, I will not do, if I shall find thirty there.

31.text: And he will say, Behold now, I have begun to speak to the Lord If twenty shall be found there? And he will say, I will not destroy for sake of twenty.

32.text: And he will say, Now will it not be angry to the Lord, and I will speak only this once: If ten shall be found there? And he will say, I will not destroy for sake of ten.

33.text: And Jehovah went forth after that he finished to speak to Abraham: and Abraham returned to his place.
